title: Department of Physical and Technical Problems of Steel Metallurgy

items: Development of theory and technology of high-temperature modeling of converter bath blowing and ladle refining of cast iron.
Increasing resource and energy saving along the technological route of steel production: blast furnace - oxygen converter.
Development, research and implementation of innovative resource and energy-efficient methods of influencing thermophysical, gas-dynamic and refining processes in steel melting baths.

Improving the efficiency of out-of-furnace steel treatment methods and improving steel casting processes by improving the conditions for using alloying, deoxidizing, heat-insulating and refining materials - additives based on improving their technological properties.

Development of proposals and justification of non-standard composition of microalloying and refining compositions, formation of recommendations for the use of by-product substandard ferroalloy production products.

Determination and use of features of hydrodynamic and thermal state of ladle metal bath during steel treatment on ladle-furnace units, degassers of various types and other out-of-furnace treatment equipment, including through regularities and levers of influence on occurring processes revealed in this case, with the aim of improving metal quality and reducing material costs at these stages of steel production.

Justification of rational placement of bottom purging unit in relation to places of introduction of lump and wire additives in steel-casting ladles of various capacity and bath geometry; determination of energy-saving modes of purging, heating, steel casting, etc.
